title.narrative: UNOPS India Strategic-Technical Support to Jal Jeevan Mission 2021

description.narrative: The support will contribute to the objectives of the Green Strategic Partnership. The purpose of partnership between the Government of Denmark and UNOPS is to provide strategic-technical support to the Indian Prime Minister’s flagship community-managed programme, the Jal Jeevan Mission, which has as its objective that by 2024, all rural households will receive drinking water supply in adequate quantity and of prescribed quality on regular and long-term basis at affordable service delivery charges, leading to improvement in living standards of rural communities. Through coordination between UNOPS and the Embassy of Denmark, it will be ensured that the partnership and the bilateral Indo-Danish cooperation on JJM mutually support and reinforce each other in order to achieve the maximum impact.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office for Project Services

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Manuals in Hindi and English and submitted to the Ministry; communication materials; Documented innovations from JJM and shared within India and outside India and dissemination of learning from Denmark; Organised National RAL Workshops and documented good practices; Created blogs on JJM for learning and sharing; Supported Government of India’s learning portal on JJM and published articles in ‘Jal Jeevan Samvad’; Organised Regional RAL workshops and documented good practices; VWSCs trained on different themes; Facilitated “Jal Samvad” (water dialogues); Prepared Village Action Plan; Women from trained on the testing of water quality; Orientation session organised; Trained plumbers on water conservation measures in domestic plumbing works; Empowered community through participatory approach of CLASS; water sources tested.
Same as mentioned in the Outcome Indicators section

• Robust systems in place and functional for planning and implementation of JJM at the National Level • Capacities for social accountability built at PRIs and State level under JJM • Lessons learned, evidence and innovative approaches: identified priority gaps are shared, disseminated and used by implementers to enhance performance of programming • Establish community-based water quality monitoring and surveillance systems and water safety protocols

• VAP (Village Action Plan) prepared and contributed to DAP (District Action Plan) and SAP (State Action Plan) • Schemes are planned and implementation within given timeframe • Community contribution in villages is started as intended. • Ownership and leadership of the JJM program at village level by PRIs ( Panchayati Raj Institutions) • VAP included as part of Gram Panchayat Development plan • PRIs initiating water conservation measures • Water quality testing is being carry out by women groups regularly and remedial measures are being undertaken with PRI support • Learning from the field are being shared and used within project and outside project. • Water quality being monitored by community on periodic basis in villages • Social audit being carried out by village water sanitation committee every quarter

target.value: • Prepared manuals as per numbers shared by the Ministry of Jal Shakti • Prepared 01 training manual, brochures, leaflets • Prepared communication materials (01 documentary on the best practice and components of the Jal Jeevan Mission and 04 short videos/films on work in 11 intervention districts) • 04 documentation/short study on the innovations and good practices from JJM and shared within India and outside India and dissemination of learning from Denmark • Organised 02 National and 04 Regional Rapid Action Learning (RAL) Workshops and documentation of good practices • Write 12 blogs on JJM for learning and sharing • Publication of 04 articles in ‘Jal Jeevan Samvad’ • VWSCs in 95 GPs trained on different themes • Facilitated “Jal Samvad” (water dialogues) in 95 GPs of 11 districts • Prepared Village Action Plan for 95 GPs of 11 districts • 100% FHTC coverage in schools, Anganwadi Centres, Health Centres, GP buildings etc. • 5 women trained on the testing of water quality
